notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.1 Extended Update Support.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
This is a kernel live patch module which is automatically loaded by the RPM post-install script to modify the code of a running kernel.

Security Fix(es):

* kernel: bad kfree in auditfilter.c may lead to escalation of privilege (CVE-2020-0444)

* kernel: locking issue in drivers/tty/tty_jobctrl.c can lead to an use-after-free (CVE-2020-29661)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Improper Clearing of Heap Memory Before Release ('Heap Inspection')

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. A logic error in audit_data_to_entry can lead to a local escalation of privilege without user interaction needed. A local attacker with special user privilege could crash the system leading to information leak. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: bad kfree in auditfilter.c may lead to escalation of privilege
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Red Hat has investigated whether a possible mitigation exists for this issue, and has not been able to identify a practical example. Please update as soon as possible.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: bad kfree in auditfilter.c may lead to escalation of privilege

notes.text: A locking vulnerability was found in the tty subsystem of the Linux kernel in drivers/tty/tty_jobctrl.c. This flaw allows a local attacker to possibly corrupt memory or escalate privileges. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: locking issue in drivers/tty/tty_jobctrl.c can lead to an use-after-free
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Red Hat has investigated whether a possible mitigation exists for this issue, and has not been able to identify a practical example. Please update as soon as possible.
